alert.note: Alert for Echols (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 11:28AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Columbia, Suwannee, Hamilton and southern Echols Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1127 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Quitman to near Suwannee River State Park to near Obrien. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake City, Live Oak, Jasper, Jennings, White Springs, Statenville, Suwannee River State Park, Suwannee Springs, Columbia and Winfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
